description: National Capacity Builfding for Disaster Risk Management

subproject.corporate outcome: National and local institutions have the capacity to respond to gender-based violence and to increase women’s civic engagement, participation and leadership in crisis prevention, ongoing crisis and post-crisis contexts
subproject.description: The devastating Kashmir earthquake in 2005, followed by the Cyclone and Floods of July 2007, and the earthquake of 2008 in Balochistan have led to a growing realization that Pakistan is exposed to a variety of hazards reflecting the diverse geo-physical and climatic conditions of the country. Attention to DRM in Pakistan has traditionally focused upon the management of floods including preparedness, response/recovery and mitigation measures. However, recent disaster events have increased awareness within government, the development community and among the public that Pakistan is a high disaster risk country. The government has taken first steps to institutionalize a Disaster Risk Management system managed by a government organization with a larger emphasis on involving multiple sectors and actors.
donor_long: UNDP AS AA FOR JP PASS THROUGH
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: CPR-One UN DRM Programme
